website_summaries.verdict: The Roku 3 adds an interface overhaul along with a nifty remote-mounted headphone jack for private listening, but the Roku 2 is a better buy.
pros: New interface is faster to navigate and is more intuitive than with previous Roku boxes
Integrated/cross channel search is incredibly useful
cons: App only currently available for iPhone/iPod Touch

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with VPN connection  be aware!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product only few months ago. At the beginning it was working completely fine and with excelent quality. Recently Roku updated the software and changed it and now it is preventing me from successfully get connected to my VPN connection. Shame on this company which changes the features of the product once you have bought it and when it is working for you. If I knew this would not work with my connetction I would never bought it. When i tryied to contact them I received a message that I was #93 in the queve and it would take 75 minutes to be attended!! Very poor customer service. Be aware, no VPN connection and extremely poor customer service!
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: Great Addition To My Entertainment System
customer_reviews.text: I am slowly cutting away from cable and this has been a great start. Has a good variety of channels and programming. Was very easy to set up. I can use the remote that came with the system, our the Android app that I downloaded onto my tablet. If you don't need 500 channels on cable this is the way to go. If fact there is so much programming on it, just like cable you won't be able to watch it all either. Some channels are free, some are subscription based like Netflix and Hulu plus. A nice piece of technology.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce R

customer_reviews.title: Love Roku, Dump Cable
customer_reviews.text: Love my Roku. I had switched to antenna TV last year when I finally had it with Comcast. I picked up a new TV, a 50 mile antenna, a wireless DVR and a Roku from Amazon and have never looked back. I get about 60 stations with my antenna from 3 nearby cities and can watch anything else on Roku. Even my local news station has a Roku channel now. It only took a few months to pay the initial input versus a cable bill and now I pay nothing except Netflix at $8/mo. The one irritating thing is that CNN, MSNBC, etc., won't let you stream live programs without a cable account. However Roku has news stations too.
customer_reviews.author: jdd

customer_reviews.title: Over four weeks and STILL waiting on support!
customer_reviews.text: ...for a solution to a 4+ week old problem. // UPDATE: Great device (5 stars); VERY BAD support (1 star). STILL waiting over a week to talk with support. I will be looking at other devices for the future. // Absolutely GREAT devices! (My last Roku lasted 6 years; still worked but had an issue with rebooting on long buffers.) REALLY like the wireless or wired network option - using wired. The device was very easy to set up again. The way my cable bill is going, this'll become the go-to device for TV soon...
customer_reviews.author: jh

customer_reviews.title: Not too bad, somewhat unreliable, if you don't mind Roku lack of customer service
customer_reviews.text: At first I liked it a lot more almost everything about it was pretty good I did have random problems but nothing too major. Now lately I've been having problems with its memory. It forgets which episode I'm on says that I've watched episodes that I have not and restarts in the wrong spot. Dealing with Roku customer service is less enjoyable than going to the dentist or used car dealer. They are epitome of bureaucratic corporate BS. The problem is every other media Corporation out there is more less about the same
customer_reviews.author: Gully Foyle

customer_reviews.title: Not Happy Roku
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had my Roku for very long and it stopped working. I called customer support and their customer support is terrible. You get people in India and most of them speak broken English and you can't understand them. They aren't helpful and they do not stand behind their product at all and will give you the runaround on the phone. I've been on the Internet and have read a lot of complaints about Roku 3 and I am horribly disappointed in this product. If you ever have problem with this you won't get any help and if it breaks down good luck with trying to get support for it.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Don't like the presentation format as well as the Roku 2
customer_reviews.text: Works well, as my Roku 2 did, but don't like the presentation format as well as the Roku 2. That might just be something to do with the way the streaming channels interpret the signals though, instead of the Roku 3 itself. Not sure. Also, it doesn't have any audio out, so had to purchase a J-Tech Digital ® Premium Quality Hdmi To Hdmi + Audio (Spdif + RCA Stereo) Audio Extractor Converter in order to connect to my soundbar. $39.99 with Amazon Prime.
customer_reviews.author: truthseeker57

customer_reviews.title: We love Roku at our house - Fantastic invention
customer_reviews.text: This is our third Roku at our house. We are a Roku household. Love the headphone jack on the Roku 3. Roku is so easy and quick to install. Roku setup beats the setup of internet TVs or internet DVD players any day. We can barely remember our pre-Roku days..... So many channels, so much to see. I still haven't cut the cable cord yet but I'm sure I will in the near future all thanks to Roku. We also enjoy the selection and quality of internet streaming free videos on Amazon Prime. Heaps of praise to those little but powerful and entertaining Roku devices.
customer_reviews.author: ndenver

customer_reviews.title: Great - unless you want to pass audio to zone 2 :-(
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little box, but like so many others, I was really disappointed Roku eliminated the digital optical audio output. Sure, you get your audio over HDMI, but most consumer-grade receivers DO NOT pass HDMI audio to zone 2. My Denon AVR-890 is one such example. I want to play Pandora music in other rooms, and that is not possible with my receiver and HDMI audio (which is the ONLY audio output for the Roku 3). To resolve this, I had to grab to additional items:   So with some added installation time and expense, I can now enjoy audio from Roku 3 in my zone 2 rooms.
customer_reviews.author: crimsongator

customer_reviews.title: Cord cutters unite
customer_reviews.text: Used daily for over 4 years. Easy to set up and use. This has paid for itself 100x over. No cable since purchase and no looking back! If you are addicted to cable it probably isn’t gonna change your world. If you can get some over the air local channels and don’t rely so heavily on television then this is for you. We use it to stream music, podcasts, YouTube content and free movies.
customer_reviews.author: jb

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS!
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't love this little device any more than I do! The headphone option is fantastic for late night movie watching with sleeping kiddos. Had it for a year and it's GREAT! Tons of setup options for customization, but still very simple to use. More channels than you can shake a stick at - it has everything! The only downside is the screen mirroring interface is still in beta, so it has some bugs to work out (mine disconnects once per half hour on average using Samsung devices - including a Galaxy S5 and Tab3). But, that isn't a huge issue to reach over to my tablet and press two buttons to reconnect. Still awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Jenine Handley

customer_reviews.title: A great alternative to the gen3 Apple TV if you want ...
customer_reviews.text: A great alternative to the gen3 Apple TV if you want more content to stream. Others I know have Google chromecast as well as other streaming devices. I've got everyone hooked on these Roku 3 devices. If you're considering a streaming device, make this your first stop. The channel store (and the ability to add private channels as well) make for a large amount of content to go through. Definitely helps to have at least a few paid-for services like Netflix, Hulu, and Amazon Prime (or Vudu or any other streaming service, this supports anything I can think of). Also, Plex is a must if you have offline content you want to stream to your Roku!
customer_reviews.author: Michael C.

customer_reviews.title: ( I do like to keep tabs of what devices and traffic are ...
customer_reviews.text: Still running years later, we have streamed the daylights of of this little bugger and still working. Still thing that the wired network in it is somehow flaky but haven't been able to prove conclusively it is the hard ware of the Roku OS. Wish you could have a manual wired setup where you could specify IP, Gateway and Subnet mask. I have to resort to either putting it on a vlan or employing DHCP/MAC filtering to assign a static to it so it doesn't move around on network. ( I do like to keep tabs of what devices and traffic are on my networks)
customer_reviews.author: FuzzyLogician

customer_reviews.title: Kicked cable to the curb.
customer_reviews.text: For helping me kick cable tv to the curb, this little Roku box deserves five stars. It's so easy to set up and use. There are lots of stuff to watch. If you get Hula, Netflix, or Amazon Prime you are set. I have tried all three but I think Amazon Prime is better for me, I enjoy Amazon free two days shipping and I love to read. Even without any of these payed service you still have plenty to watch with this Roku 3 Streaming Media Player. I recommend this to anyone who is looking to kick their cable or satellite television service to the curb. This little box will save you lots of money. Thank you Roku Player.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Amazon Channel Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Love Roku, Hate Amazon Channel. I have had every Roku that has come out and they are great but within the last 6 months the Amazon channel on Roku has gone to garbage. It is the only channel that won't fully load, it has huge black bars on top and bottom, navigating the channel forces you to sift through subscription channels you don't own and there are grey empty boxes where the cover image should be. Contacting Amazon never accomplishes anything. The tech I spoke with said they upgraded the system for 4k uhd but in doing so made anything less than that much worse.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Atrocious customer support.
customer_reviews.text: It didn't "automatically connect" to my wireless network, as it promised in the enclosed instructions. In fact, my wireless network couldn't locate it. No troubleshooting instructions included with the product. The links to the instructions on the Roku site weren't working, either. The expected wait for telephone tech support was 50 minutes at 8:00 in the evening. I have no interest in companies like this who think so little of their customers they can't provide timely tech support, especially for new product set-up. I received a full refund from Amazon, the only hero in this time-consuming fiasco.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia S.

customer_reviews.title: No regrets, and have both Chromecast and Roku
customer_reviews.text: LOVE the remote and the headphone feature. Wish my satellite dish has that feature. I have both the chromecast and the roku. I originally thought that you would only need one or the other, but now am glad I have both after getting the Chromecast as a present. Advantages to both and here are my thoughts: Roku advantages: 1. Watching amazon instant video (can't do on chromecast nicely), 2. More channels to watch 3. Remote 4. Multiple models to fit the one best for your needs. Chromecast: 1. Casting a tab from your computer. This is HUGE to be able to watch some things that Roku just doesn't support.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye Cable. Hello Roku.
customer_reviews.text: The Roku has revolutionized how we watch TV in my household. With or without a Plex server, Roku is great. It handles Netflix, Amazon, Hulu, and other major streaming services. Many excellent free options (like PBS) are available as well. I prefer the Roku 3 over previous models because it has a wired connection - which is faster than the WiFi-only options. If you are going to use the Roku's usb connectivity to watch files you've stored externally, there are filetype limitations. The Roku can not handle avi files. You'll either need to convert those files to mp4 (through demuxing) or use the Plex Media Server (or equivalent) to transcode the file on the fly.
customer_reviews.author: Myron Getman

customer_reviews.title: Not up to the hype
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it has nice features like wireless headphone and game playing capability, and over a thousand digital channels. It is an ok streaming player, but a extremely poor media player. With today's technology, a media with such limited supported formats. It is a disappointment. I initially give Roku a two star. After a few days of use, I decided to give it a one star. Some chaneels that initially worked and stopped working couple of days later. I cannot do more than a smart TV do. Yes, more channels, but mostly useless. Roku just added another layer of charge over existing channels, but not doing one thing extra in improving your viewing enjoyment. Wake up. Trash Roku.
customer_reviews.author: TThomas

customer_reviews.title: We recommend Roku
customer_reviews.text: We are another family that gave up cable and use our Roku along with a new paper-thin antenna that allows us to receive broadcast TV. The options provided by the Roku are many--and along with Amazon and Netflix streaming we always find something to watch. Our favorites besides the previous services include, PBS, Internet radio, YouTube, and Crackle. There are even several 24-7 news streams available, including the new CBS offering. At various times, we have subscribed to HuluPlus, though we have lately dropped it. The new Roku is easy to set up and use, providing sharp picture and sound. The latest was our third Roku purchase, and we continue to recommend it to friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: JMAlexandria

customer_reviews.title: i love this thing
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Simple easy-to-use interface Smaller than a slice of bread (good for travel). Took this to my dads campground with an external drive and we were able to watch movies USB port for connecting external drive (your personal movie collection) Low price (1 time fee for the device and low cost netflix and amazon plans and NHL package ..... and no more cable bill) Fast - the movie/TV selections start much faster than I was expecting and faster than on-demand on cable Simple intuitive remote. Only has what you need and what you want Cons: You can't quite get rid of cable YET if you want to watch certain cable programs. But I think this will change with time.
customer_reviews.author: GoldenElkLad

customer_reviews.title: Neat feature in the remote to plug in headphones
customer_reviews.text: I've not yet tried the headphone jack in the remote yet but it's a cool feature for us folks who like to watch a flick in bed while our partner's asleep! I like the intuitive guide and maneuverability of the remote features and the systems. Much better than on my Samsung bluray and PS3 we also use along with a sony bluray. those are neat to use due to the secondary feature being net access for Netflix-our favorite- but also the bluray players as primary features. The Roku shows it's designed as a stand alone player and it good at it!
customer_reviews.author: JackRealtor

customer_reviews.title: Love Our Roku!
customer_reviews.text: My family and I were looking for an alternative to our cable and the Roku 3 has exceeded our expectations! It is easy to navigate and add favorite channels. I do wish it had the capability of finding what show is available on what channel. My memory isn't what it use to be. So I stick with 3 basic channels but would love to use more on a regular basis. Having the capability of seeing shows in list for on any given channel without having to search each channel would be extremely helpful! This may be a feature on newer models of Roku devices. But overall, we are VERY pleased with our Roku and would recommend it to others!
customer_reviews.author: Tammy L

customer_reviews.title: Strongly Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: This is an outstanding product - you can't go wrong. It is way better than the Apple Box which has very limited interfaces and flexibility but Apple just presents prettier screens. What I especially love about the Roku 3 is that I can also include my Amazon Prime access - the Apple Box does not allow any third party apps not included on their box. So Roku by far is the winner of the two. The kids and I both love all the flexibilty it provides and it is super simple to use. Moreover the remote allows the kids to listen to their programs silently by plugging the ear buds provided into the Roku remote. Is life any better? SOLD!
customer_reviews.author: Hld

customer_reviews.title: Roku are always good
customer_reviews.text: Good purchase. I have used the google player, have two smart hub TV's, the Amazon Firestick, and 3 roku. I am slowly moving everything over to Roku. All the others are inferior to the Roku. I liked the firestick at first but it stutters and sometimes looses sound - it also would not work in my upstairs east bedroom so I replaced it with a roku and everything is great again. When my TV's go out I will not be getting smart TV's again but will just use Roku's on them. Absolutely no other product I have tried has come remotely close to the performance of the rokus in my home. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Weis

customer_reviews.title: Roku rocks!
customer_reviews.text: I love Roku! Roku is an amazing way to access Netflix and other streaming media. They are cheap, easy to use, and offer hours upon hours of entertainment. The remote is simple. Even my three-year-old son can breeze through and find his shows on Netflix and YouTube very easily. Even if you don't have a Netflix subscription, there are plenty of channels that Roku provides in order to keep you entertained. Set up is easy and you can even use your iPhone or iPad to operate it if you don't want to use the remote or have lost it. Customer service is excellent! I have a Roku on every television in my house.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't live without my Roku
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd Roku over the years. Easy to setup and use. LOVE the new earphone jack on the remote feature. I'm hard of hearing and this works like a gem. Volume not only louder, but CLEARER than most speakers. I've read some complaints how this feature eats up batteries fast. It's true, but I bought a battery charge, and rechargeable batteries, so the need to change is no problem. A charge lasts 203 days, then are replaced by newly charged ones,
customer_reviews.author: Maverick

customer_reviews.title: Replaced cable with this, its awesome
customer_reviews.text: Had Roku for about 2 years now, and it is fantastic. I primarily enjoy netflix and movies so I don't have cable. This thing provides all the fun of computer shows online, straight to your TV. You can even load a USB with shows or movies right into the back of it. The remote is very simple and doesn't have confusing useless buttons like most. The rewind button is actually a lot of fun too, takes the show back 7 seconds or so. Perfect for when you buddy talks over an important line, or there was a big movie moment you need to instantly see again. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Locke

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy any smart tv,  buy roku, the smart component of any tv.
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your bucks on any smart tv, its apps get outdated every 2 or 3 years. Recently youtube and facebook updated their APIs, so our tv apps became useless. Instead of buying a new tv, we bought roku and discovered that is the perfect module for the tv. It's core is to stream, they are outstanding doing this, better than any tv maker. And their software keeps updated, while tv's software is vaguely outdated. There is no such thing as a smart tv, just a tv bundled with some apps that will become useless in 2 or three years.
customer_reviews.author: datelligence

customer_reviews.title: The best yet
customer_reviews.text: I've been a Roku user and fan for years. The Roku 3 has a nice new interface and a new remote with cool features, the best of which is an earphone jack for purely private listening. The earphone jack alone is enough to recommend this product. Like I said, I've been using Rokus for years. The earlier Roku's had a tendency to "lose their minds" at times, requiring a power-off reset. Not this Roku 3! It's stable and the interface is very responsive, very quick. Recommend highly.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mark Davis

customer_reviews.title: Best streaming devices on the market
customer_reviews.text: Best streaming devices on the market! The Roku 3 does not disappoint. Apart from the huge selection of public channels such as hulu and netflix there is also a large assortment of private channels that can be found over the internet. I love the headphone jack built into the remote, perfect for when i stay up a little later than my wife. It does drain the remote batteries pretty quickly but its worth it. This is my fourth Roku, I have been buying them since they first came out and have never been disapointed with a product.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Compter

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Media Player
customer_reviews.text: My mother has been asking for the Roku for a while. After spending lots of research comparing streaming media players/sticks, I decided to go with the Roku 3. Overall, this has been an excellent product. The only think that I noticed is the media player works better by connecting your Ethernet cable directly. The WiFi does work fine, but I noticed that it likes the router to be within about 10 feet. For the price, I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: MusikFaktory

customer_reviews.title: Potential 100% - Reality, Not So Much.
customer_reviews.text: Crashes a bit too often for my liking, and what's with the lack of updates for the available apps. The styling of the apps on this Roku are very outdated. Reminds me of the way websites looked in the late 90's. I fear Roku may not update their apps, at all. It seems perhaps they just release a new Roku and expect you to buy the new version to get any type of update. I love the concept and potential of what Roku brings to the table however, the reality is a bit lacking. I like the Roku OK, but the lack of updates makes me question the business model.
customer_reviews.author: BrainSpout

customer_reviews.title: Cut the cable cord!!
customer_reviews.text: Cut the cable cord & get the Roku! I haven't had cable in a year & have just been using my Roku. And I don't miss cable one bit! Especially now that they offer HBO & Showtime standalone, I never have to use cable again. I use this in conjunction with a Hulu Plus, Amazon Prime & Netflix account & am super happy. The Roku does have free apps, like Comedy Central, PBS, etc. It makes it so easy to watch TV without cable. I highly recommend one to anyone!!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Great streaming device with lots of channels.
customer_reviews.text: I like this device but the streaming of locally stored files required the Plex channel, which I eventually had to pay for. Unless I missed a link on google or something in the directions on how to get the Roku to stream local files, it's a great device with a ton of available channels, great playback quality, fast streaming (though I'm using the ethernet port, I've tested out the wireless connection) and is very compact. The headphone jack in the remote is great when you don't want to disturb anyone, even though I use a universal remote control. Four stars only because there is no native way to stream files over the local network.
customer_reviews.author: AvidAmazoner

customer_reviews.title: the best part:  some TV series have ZERO commercials
customer_reviews.text: During Dec 2014 I watched a movie on cable. The movie running time, according to wikipedia, was 105 minutes. The movie was scheduled for 7-10:30 (210 min). That was almost 2 hours of commercials. I timed the commercials. The movie averaged 8 minutes of straight commercials, 9-10 minutes of movie, another 8 minutes of commercials, 9-10 minutes of movie, etc. Half way during that movie I decided to cut the cable cord. Why didn't I do this years ago? There are soo many viewing options now when I turn on my TV/roku that it is overwhelming. And the best part - some TV series have ZERO commercials, others have 1-2 minutes. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: sonybalony

customer_reviews.title: Haven't had any problems besides addiction
customer_reviews.text: Got it for my hubby for Christmas and I think I am just as in love with this thing, if not more in love! He really wanted the Roku 3 and I really had no idea what it was, but I'm glad I decided to get it! We watch it every day! Warning: Once you have a Roku, Netflix becomes more dangerous and life-altering than ever before. Then again we don't have cable. I did read random reviews mentioning the wifi/internet speed determining how efficient the Roku 3 is. This is true. When our wifi has its whacky reset moments, everything stops streaming and sometimes freezes. It happened like...twice.
customer_reviews.author: Allysen W.

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. Makes life wonderfully simple. However, it would be much nicer if it didn't require me to have a tv provider to gain access to many of the channels. We got this because we don't use cable. The interface is nicer on the 3 than the two and allows me to choose the viewer on Netflix which is GREAT when you have kids in the house. On the 2 the main account holder is the only netflix you watch so it's tailored to fit their viewing pleasures. When kids are watching I only want them to have access to kids shows so the 3 makes that possible!
customer_reviews.author: MamaOfTwo

customer_reviews.title: Fine streaming player, good for Amazon, plus plenty of other channels
customer_reviews.text: Use this in my home theatre, where I also have a Verizon FIOS STB and Apple TV. I use the Roku mostly for Amazon Prime content, but it also has dozens (perhaps hundreds) of channels. Picture quality is very good, and sound it also very good, delivering Dolby Digital where available (top quality sound is very important to me). Operation is reliable, although I have to (once in a while) reboot to get the sound to work. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: David Wess

customer_reviews.title: Do your self a favor and pass it by
customer_reviews.text: I still use this for Sky News, Euronews, youtube, and a few Christian channels. More and more adverts are creeping in and almost all stations and films require a payment. It often crashes. Even on free channels they ask for a dollar per film to view it without ads, if you refuse to pay expect many disruptions during viewing, like the same ad 3 times every 5 minutes and of course the crashes and freezes, they really begrudge you if you refuese them the all important dollar free ad viewing fee, and many of the channels show films from way back when including silent movies.
customer_reviews.author: Bryn-mor Williams

customer_reviews.title: I abandoned my smart TVs for this and will never look back.
customer_reviews.text: Output is HDMI only. If you need audio or video via something other than HDMI, buy something else. I love these Roku units. After my Samsung "smart" TVs stopped being able to stream video from any source for a few days due to a hard-coded dependency on a DNS server in Korea that was down, I unplugged the ethernet cable from the TVs and hooked them up to Roku 3s. I should have done it years ago! Roku's user interface is infinitly better, faster, easier, more reliable, etc. My so-called Smart TVs are now plain-old TVs, with the smarts provided by a little box hanging off the back of them -- yeah Roku!
customer_reviews.author: A. Wing

customer_reviews.title: I still don't see the advantages, clunky design.
customer_reviews.text: I got the chrome cast as soon as it came out in a good friend of mine recommended this Roku3 for a 2nd TV. After a year I still dislike the way the system works. Having to have an extra remote and not able to just use my phone seems annoying and less intuitive. When searching for specific movies/shows having to type in the name using the arrow keys is very aggravating. I do like that the remote has a headphone jack. Maybe I'm still missing something but I do not see the advantages of this high-cost device over something smaller and more affordable...like any of the sticks out there today that cost under $50.
customer_reviews.author: Jill_M.

customer_reviews.title: Using it without any issues for 2 years now
customer_reviews.text: This is the best streamer right now: Cut the cable! What I don't like? Hard to say, perhaps that it does not have a USB connector so you can plug your flash and stream your movies? And the browser, is set by the company. Would like to be able to access Gmail or even Google, but again there may be some legal issues here. Wish list? a small keyboard so you don't have to use the clumsy on screen one. But hey! you can't have it all..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a winner!
customer_reviews.text: This was probably the best entertainment product we have purchased. Small, easy to install and easy to use. There are step by step instructions for installing ... not much to it at all. The remote control works simply and easily from across the room. Once you join the Roku site and set up an account, you can pick from many free channels. We have a paid Netflix subscription which we stream through the Roku and enjoy it so much more than using our laptop to connect to TV. After two years, we have found no real problems with the Roku 3 and would recommend it. In fact, most evenings we watch one of our Roku channels instead of cable TV.
customer_reviews.author: TM Ohio

customer_reviews.title: There is NO OFF SWITCH- has to be unplugged
customer_reviews.text: I have bought two of these- One for my husband in the hospital & bedroom when he was ill (connected to wifi) & one for me in the family room (connected to Ethernet). My only one complaint is that there is no OFF switch- you have to unplug it. So beware if you have a sluggish internet connection or modem/router. Otherwise, I couldn't be happier having all the apps at my convenience on NON-Smart televisions. Had to buy HDMI hubs- no other connection available on this device. But, I read the reviews and was prepared for this. Another FANTASTIC feature is the headphones (I can actually fall asleep while my husband is in bed watching)!!
customer_reviews.author: Prayon F. Kreutz

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Dumping cable was one of my best decisions in recent years. I don't have other streaming devices to compare it to, so all I can say is - this does what it's supposed to do, has lasted more than a couple years (I'm late in reviewing stuff) and I've had no problem with it whatsoever. Except ... The volume buttons on the side of the remote don't affect my volume, so I have to use my TV remote for that. But lord only know why. I've never, ever been able to use just ONE remote, so I don't necessarily fault the ROKU for this. Oh, and they shipped quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Marti W

customer_reviews.title: Buy this and NEVER go back.
customer_reviews.text: THANK GAWD I am FINALLY FREE FROM SATELLITE!!!! My goodness, I want to scream that from rooftops across America! Since I have Netflix and Amazon as well as Hulu Plus, this HAS been the "be all/END all" in our house for video entertainment. GONE are the gays of $135.00/mo satellite charges! The choices for the "free" programming isn't bad. The ready access to PBS is GLORIOUS. The machine is idiot-proof, and considering for the "most" part you are COMMERCIAL FREE and it cost LESS than ONE MONTH'S cost of "the alternative" (Cough - DISH - cough - Direct TV-cough) it's a complete no-brainer. This IS the best thing since sliced bread. FREE.AT.LAST.
customer_reviews.author: Gypsy Earthspirit

customer_reviews.title: Headphone jack in remote YES PLEASE
customer_reviews.text: Only had the Roku 3 for about a week now. But so far I'm loving it. My favorite feature is the headphone jack in the remote, since my wive always falls asleep on the couch. So I can toss on my headphones and start watching my shows as loud as I want. Personally didn't care for the headphones it came with, since it suffered from the same annoying as other ones of this type, you can hear the thumb when it hits your chest or any hard surface. It's only been a short time, but so far I've been loving it. I use it for Netflix, Amazon Prime, Hulu Plus, and Plex (for local media).
customer_reviews.author: Drofnas

customer_reviews.title: Using it every day
customer_reviews.text: had it for several months. So far works well. there are a few times netflix freed, but can be fixed easily. Good that it also has a headphone interface on the remote. It is nice to have apps on cell phone and ipad, although I did not use it much. expendable with those private channels. HD quality is good. It will sleep by itself when I turns my TV off. Easy to use. Don't like the registration part for a lot of channels, especially don't like being asked for credit card information when I am not even purchasing. But for some channels I can skip the credit card information part.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I was previously using WDTV. Roku 3 wins it hands down. Its super fast, WD took forever to load. Roku 3 was quick and seamless loading. The Roku logo that comes out amuses my kids. Super love the following features: 1) channels - can we have more of these? 2) headphones socket in the controller - I love love love this feature. Super handy when trying to watch an action packed movie without disturbing the sleeping kids! All controllers should have this feature! 3) super cute! - small, hardly take up any space and hardly noticeably. But wields such power! 4) super easy set up...almost a no brainer. If you havent already, time for an upgrade!!
customer_reviews.author: oneeightythree

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't get better than this
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't get better than this. I am planning to cut the cord soon (drop cable tv, keep cable Internet) and I am finding that after an initial adjustment period I prefer using the Roku to using the cable tuner. I have Amazon Prime (great free and paid content), Netflix, and Hulu (all paid content) subscriptions as well as a couple of smaller content providers. Surprisingly (not really), my Time Warner app is the most unreliable. It will periodically refuse to connect. Although logging into their website seems to help. Very, very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Graham

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I've given several products 5 stars when they have been really good... but out of everything I've reviewed and praised, my Roku is probably the most well deserved 5 star product. I won't go on and on about what it does.... plenty of others have already mentioned it's features. For me, it's all about how easy it is to use, the well designed remote, it's easy to navigate menu system, and all of the apps available for it. Personally, my favorite app is Plex, which allows me to access my video library on my plex server located at my home.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin N.

customer_reviews.title: Great product - and its remote survived a washer and dryer!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a couple of years back - before all of the other streaming devices were available. At the time, my son (for whom it was primarily intended) had the controls figured out in no time. Soon we had separate profiles set up for NetFlix - and he could easily pick up on shows that he was part-way through. On very rare occasions it has sputtered or stalled' generally a quick unplug resets whatever bug caused the problem. Great product - and really easy for children to use. Actually - true story - the remote went through our washer AND dryer with the batteries still inside. And, lucky us, it still worked.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: My third Roku box
customer_reviews.text: Over the years, I've purchased the Roku XD-S, Roku 2 XS, and finally the Roku 3. I was perfectly happy with the Roku 2 XS, but the XD-S' wireless capability stopped working which necessitated the purchase of a Roku 3. Setting up the Roku 3 is a breeze. This isn't surprising, since installation for all previous Rokus have been simple. What surprises me is the Roku 3 is MUCH faster than the Roku 2: the channels are more responsive and the videos load quicker. I wasn't expecting a noticeable upgrade. The channels I regularly use are Amazon Prime, Netflix, Vudu, and PlayOn. I cut the cable cord over a year ago and have not missed it at all. Thanks Roku!
customer_reviews.author: kahlia72

customer_reviews.title: This thing is the best
customer_reviews.text: This is the best streaming box. I upgraded from a roku 1 for the hd streaming. Having a roku saves me a ton of money. I don't have cable anymore instead I have Netflix and Amazon Prime. The roku works really well and for some reason streams better than my computer. I had a roku 2 and it would occasionally crash, no such problem with the roku 3. The headphone jack is great for late night or early morning tv watching while others are sleeping. I can not say enough good about his thing. Pros Good quality streaming Radio remote Remote headphone jack Software is easily navigated Setup took 10 minutes A ridiculous amount of available content
customer_reviews.author: LostFound

customer_reviews.title: easy way to stream to your TV
customer_reviews.text: The roku 3 was easy to install and set up. The navigation through the menus is simple using the remote. I got the app for the iphone that allows you to control the roku if the phone is on the same wifi network. It is easier to type in search terms using the phone. I use it to stream amazon prime on my TV. I also use ti to watch PBS that is available at their website for streaming. The picture and sound are just fine. The roku remote has a jack for plugging in head phones. I plug in my computer speakers for better sound then my TV speakers.
customer_reviews.author: kkl89

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Amazon Instant Video & Roomie remote
customer_reviews.text: We are Prime subscribers, and also have a moderate collection of purchased Amazon Instant Video (mainly TV series). We had been using a Sony Blu Ray player with Amazon Instant capability to watch shows, but the interface was archaic and cumbersome. It kept rebuffering despite a Fios 50/20 connection that would consistently test well even when rebuffering. The search for a better solution led us to Roku. The short version is that the interface is at least an order of magnitude easier to use, and what really seals the deal is that it interfaces easily with the Roomie remote system for iOS - which made it integrate very readily into our home entertainment system.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Lee

customer_reviews.title: Delivers on promise - I can watch TedTalk and YouTube now :D
customer_reviews.text: Very fast streaming, nice menu, and delivers on promise. Every few years, I upgrade our Roku player to the current model and I hesitated not only due to the price but if it would deliver on its promises. (A previous version didn't.) Not only did this deliver on the promise but surpassed our expectations. Movies stream faster (I use a direct connection via a cable) than the previous version and the Roku menu is very easy to use. On a previous version, I couldn't watch TedTalk videos without streaming errors. However, on this model TedTalk and now YouTube videos play without any issues. We use it not only for the channels mentioned but Amazon, Netflix, and Hulu.
customer_reviews.author: dr Frank

customer_reviews.title: How did I live without this?
customer_reviews.text: FINALLY bought a Roku (and dropped all TWC services) and am kicking myself for waiting so long! I pay in a year what I used to pay in a month for cable. I was looking at the roku stick but this is ultimately more stable and has a proven history of working. It's also pretty small and not an eyesore anyways. It hooked up easy and had 3 months free Hulu plus to boot. It's streamed with only one issue since purchase ..... And it still worked but the logos didn't load.... Fixed about 6hrs later. I recommend everyone cut cable and buy a roku and the top streaming applications!
customer_reviews.author: Wingnut

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Great little streaming box for the average user! My girlfriend is in love with this thing. It lets her watch hulu, netflix, and play a few casual games, which is all the things she wanted it for. The ability to use headphones in the remote was a real selling point for her as she is a bit of a night owl and worries she keeps other people awake. The UI is really responsive and easy to understand, and the actual programs are really snappy, with fast load times. The video looks awesome, and audio is great. If you're on the fence about getting one of these, just do it, you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: DrMadFellow

customer_reviews.title: Mine was broken - would not upgrade software
customer_reviews.text: I have several Roku devices. All work perfectly, even the 4 year old ones. I bought this new for my daughter. Software would not update. Lots of research. Reset it a dozen times. Just will not complete an update. The internet connection is great, so that is not the cause. Also, the Amazon app crashed every time it opened. I sent it back. I am sure most Roku devices work well, but I did read a disturbing number of comments on the Internet about people who had the same problem as me. I am dinging this down to 2 stars because I wasted a couple hours trying to make it upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Blutarsky

customer_reviews.title: Roku 3 wonderful
customer_reviews.text: For me the Roku 3 does it all as an addition to any TV hook up you might have.Or you could cut the cable and just use this.It sets up so easy anyone can do it.Since I have a Netfix plan and Amazon Prime I was set to go .You need to sign in with Roku that account is not used unless you want to.The surfing for movies or from channel to channel is faster than using the cable guide.For me Roku 3 is proven and has all the bugs worked out .I would recommend it to anyone over the other products out there .
customer_reviews.author: Mace

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye awful quality streaming on the Wii
customer_reviews.text: This thing is fantastic, and I have barely scratched the service. With just the ease of use, and simple installation I was pretty satisfied. Let alone how quickly everything functions, and how easy they make using Netflix, Hulu etc. it is definitely a 5 star product. I can't wait to try the hidden channels! **Warning** - If you pick and choose what you read, be sure you purchase an HDMI cable separate as it does not come with one. Please don't spend more than $5-$10 on the cable, or you're getting ripped off.
customer_reviews.author: William Hall

customer_reviews.title: Most Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: The Roku 3 is a substantial improvement over the Roku HD player I already own. I purchased it because it was advertised and reviewed as much faster, and able to hold more apps. I was also intrigued by the headphones which plug into the remote. It has met my expectations and then some. I have not as yet found any use for the USB or microSD slots. The unit was easy to set up and has been completely reliable. I use it connected by (gigabit) ethernet so I cannot comment on it's wireless connectivity. The remote is very satisfactory as regards functionality and range, and the headphone feature works very well and is quite useful.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Unacceptable Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I am giving Roku 2 stars for Customer Service. I got the Roku 3 less than two months ago, then the audio stopped working. Following a long list of troubleshooting with the chat-support person, I was told to send the defective player to Roku and wait another week *once they receive it* to get a new one. I was told I will bear the shipping costs to getting it to them. I gave the person a chance to pay for my shipping of the defective player or I will take my business to the Fire TV. He kept citing policy and I said good day! It's a shame; Roku will fail over customer service; they did for me at least.
customer_reviews.author: nirnear

customer_reviews.title: Great streaming device
customer_reviews.text: As a long-time owner of a Roku 2, and a huge fan of Roku in general, I can easily say the Roku 3 is an excellent purchase. While not an amazing interface upgrade from the Roku 2, you will notice a lot of great improvements: Speed navigating through menus, overall construction of the device, headphone jack on the remote (more useful than I thought). Great, solid product, tons of offerings, much more open source than some other streaming devices. I love it, and have happily recommended it to others. Great combo with the free My Media server as well.
customer_reviews.author: C. Lord

customer_reviews.title: Best gadget I've bought in years!
customer_reviews.text: Best gadget I've bought in years. Totally changed my entertainment habits. The device works well and with good internet service performance is great. What people get confused about is what is available without extra cost. There are SOME selections from network and cable channels but the options are just not that great. Same for movie selection, not much quality for free. So I would highly recommend a premium channel with ANY streaming device. I use Amazon Prime and get a great selection of TV shows and movies for $99 a year. Netflix is another option. I also have a PLEX media server and have all my DVDs ripped for instant access.
customer_reviews.author: Rootman

customer_reviews.title: Giant upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Roku 3 for my daughter for Christmas, and to my surprise she had bought one for me as well. We both had aging Roku 1's and wanted something with more performance and options. The Roku 3 far exceeded my expectations in every area. Ease of installation was a big one, and everything after that was as advertised down to the details. I cant imagine anyone being disappointed with this streaming device...whats not to like....( I don't work for Roku, sorry if this sounds like an add ) I guess I'm just pleased when something works like its suppose to.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Murry

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Got this unit only because it could be hard wired to the network (CAT5 plug). My wireless tends to drop do to other wireless signals in the area. Its much faster now. Lots of free stuff available. To get better stuff you will have to subscribe to a streaming service like Amazon prime. I use it on a 50" that does not have integrated internet available on it. The Roku is the perfect bridge. Using HDMI you get great HD. I can see the threat to expanded cable with these streaming services. They do work great. Broadband is the best to work good with this service. Faster the better because it cuts buffering time(s).
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Better than Chrome Cast by leaps and bounds
customer_reviews.text: I can actually say this is the best thing since sliced bread. Since purchasing this baby I have not stopped being in awe of it, I almost feel like a groupie!!!! Definitely worth the buy and try. I had a Google Chromecast and that was great as a streaming device until I got this and realized the chromecast is just clunky and limiting because you have to use a phone or tablet with it. The only drawback to the Roku is the typing functionality which I think could benefit from a better layout of letters. I got an app for my blackberry that's made typing through the Roku so much better!!! Back in love again!!
customer_reviews.author: Brent Fermin

customer_reviews.title: Another satisfied customer
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing. I got it because my Sony Blu Ray player was absolutely useless for streaming because it constantly buffered. I have had the Roku for a few months now and never had a single thing stop playing to buffer. I'm also stunned at the number of channels offering free GOOD content. Like the History Channel with full episodes of Vikings, the Smithsonian channel with brilliant documentaries, every major American news channel, and numerous music channels. The radio controller is also incredibly cool. I've tested it from several rooms away and it works. This is the best purchase you can make if you are a cable cutter.
customer_reviews.author: Ella Quin

customer_reviews.title: I can see why people are cutting the cord
customer_reviews.text: This little media streamer is loaded with channels. I purchased this because I wanted to see what the hype was all about. I have a smart blu ray player with apps, but it doesn't nearly have the channels that this thing does. News, tv shows, movies, some sports, music, social media, everything you would want in a media player. It is always "on" so start up speed is no issue. Setup was extremely easy. It found my wireless network, put in my password, then it downloaded software with an update. After that, the streaming fun began. You can add/delete channels easily. If it were not for live sports, this would be my main entertainment device. Loving the Roku 3!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: I love love love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I love love love this thing! Set-up was a breeze. Any Netflix title at my fingertips. YouTube videos look fantastic on my 50" tv. I was afraid the quality would suffer from being enlarged so much, but it's fine. Looking forward to exploring other channels available, many are pay but free ones look interesting. I don't mind giving them my credit card info, everybody else has it, cable company, phone co, multiple department stores... If that is a deterrent for you, get a pre-paid visa or mc from the grocery or drug store. It's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Donnie

customer_reviews.title: Even better than I hoped
customer_reviews.text: Who would have thought that this little box could improve Viewing is an age of 250+ channel availability? Not Me! But this little box has given me the chance to see all the great programs, movies and series that have given me so much enjoyment. I can see a movie from several different providers, watch the BBC programs I love, Laugh at the comedies that always make me chuckle, and still have access to those 250+ channels on my regular programming provider. And it is all just plug, find my Wi-Fi and pick a source to view. Even an old lady, like me, can do it. I love it!!
customer_reviews.author: P. Penwood

customer_reviews.title: Best streaming device
customer_reviews.text: I have a ton of streaming devices, including PS3, smart TV, chromecasts, Google tv box, and more. And the Roku is by far the best, simple, and easy to use. It works the most consistently, compared to the others. And has the most content. I mostly use my rokus for Plex, Netflix, Amazon Prime, HBO Go, and sometimes I use some of the channels live, A&E, History, Showtime, etc. I have Directv, so I can't sign in to the ABC/Disney owned channels (like ESPN, Disney, etc) or the Fox channels. But I'm hoping I will soon enough. When I first got our first Roku, I couldn't sign in to a bunch of apps, with Directv, that I now can.
customer_reviews.author: Joe H.

customer_reviews.title: Tech geek recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love my Roku box! It has a better interface then the Apple TV and unlike the Apple TV, I don't have to point the remote directly at the Roku. My Roku box is hidden and receives the signal well. Loads fast, great interface, small form factor, great remote, headphone jack is a great feature. I highly recommend this over the competitor's set top boxes or dongles. Roku has been around for a long time and they are constantly improving. Other set top boxes or dongles are early in the game. They already have tons of channels added in their channel store. I'm a tech geek and love this box, highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Russo

customer_reviews.title: Best streaming device ever, worst customer technical support.
customer_reviews.text: Best streaming device only if the private channels are downloaded can you get the full experience otherwise they are all pay channels with all ads, so far youtube is the best channel. Don't rely on their technical support, the worst in the industry absolutely clueless. Also WIFI connections can result in slow streaming with constant buffering interruptions, the best way is direct Ethernet cable connection from your router/model or buy a Logitech HD 200a Powerline Adapter, the best alternative, no connection interruptions ever! no matter where in the home your connected.
customer_reviews.author: Frank M

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, but many quirks... and not exactly dependable.
customer_reviews.text: Yes, I do like it, but it has now started making me upset. The current issue is that it just stops and needs a power off reboot to get back active (it happened again as I was typing here). That happened just after I turned it on and it would not respond to the control. A reboot was required there also. That a couple months after Roku tech support told me to limit speed to 3.5mbps.. WHY?? Another issue is that it won't communicate with other devices without the Roku being connected with WI FI. What is wrong with ethernet????? Roku Tech support doesn't have a good reputation on here. I paid for extended support on this unit. DREADING IT!
customer_reviews.author: Bill Jones

customer_reviews.title: What made the difference for me...
customer_reviews.text: I flip-flopped between this and the amazon device. I finally gave into this one. Why? Because it does something all devices should do, let me search for a movie or TV show, and IT goes out and finds all the places the thing is, and tells me how much it's going to cost. I love that feature more than anything else. It gets us close to the "buy one device for all services" which I would pay a premium for.
customer_reviews.author: Jason A. Myers

customer_reviews.title: A great device
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time I have tried any streaming devices and I was pleasantly surprised how simple the setup was. I am probably not using all of its features, but the apps/channels that I have setup work well. I was very disappointed with Netflix channel - one of the main reasons for getting a streaming device, it kept loosing the connection with Netflix and also the movies were breaking up. I did not experience this on any of the other streaming channels - so I have canceled my subscription with Netflix. The roku works very well - for someone who is looking to limit cable or satellite this is a great option.
customer_reviews.author: Glen L

customer_reviews.title: Mount it for $5. It is a snap and needed.
customer_reviews.text: The Roku Player has the best search function I have seen. Has worked fine for us for >1 year. I put up with the thing flopping around for about a year and just had a brilliant idea that works perfectly. Buy afor about $4. Put the hooks through the vent on the back of your TV, then snap the Roku under the springs. Voila! Thank me later for saving you 15 bucks...
customer_reviews.author: Ready4Retirement

customer_reviews.title: Who needs cable when Roku is around?
customer_reviews.text: My smart TV could only stream Netflix and Amazon flawlessly, forget streaming anything else. Although Roku claimed the streamer would not he,lp with speed it must have helped with something because I can stream just about anything with my Roku 3. I have subscriptions with Netflix, Amazon and Hulu Plus and there are many, many free channels, too. I now pay less than $25 per month for streaming where I used to pay more than $100 per month for satellite! Who needs cable or satellite when Roku is around? I absolutely love my Roku 3. I watch something on it almost daily. I would recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: MonCherie

customer_reviews.title: Roku 3 Streaming Media Player
customer_reviews.text: We now have four of these attached to different TV's. They work very well and we love the TV programs it can get with no ads. Watching a half hour TV show without ads is a great experience...no interruptions for stupid time wasting garbage is a plus for me.....and that is why we have four of them. A further benefit is that there a many more programs on ROKU that one does not get on regular TV and Roku with it's array of program suppliers gives a much more of a range of shows to watch without ads. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Carter

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I was kind of upset to have to use 2 added remotes for this, one to change HDMI connections (my Sony remote that I haven't used in years) and the ROKU remote. Happily I found out that I could put the ROKU in the drawer because the ROKU app on my iphone works great. I am on episode 10 of NYPD Blue (gotta love Sipowitz) using free Amazon Prime Videos and the little "black box". The closed caption allows us to understand lots more. If you have an HD that's not smart, this little baby sends it off to school. BTW, had the Chromecast and it was cool but did not (at this time) have Amazon Prime Videos.
customer_reviews.author: RJ Schinner

customer_reviews.title: Awesome all in one streaming player!
customer_reviews.text: Before I bought this device I was using a logitech Revue for Netflix and a sony bluray player for hulu plus and amazon instant video. With the Roku 3 I get all of these in one fast easy to use box. Pros: -Fast -Intuitive and easy to use interface -Small box that doesn't take up much room -Good remote -Complimentary pair of okay earbuds -Plug in earbuds to the remote feature works very well Cons: -No YouTube channel Conclusion: Best streaming player out there. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: June

customer_reviews.title: get one now!
customer_reviews.text: I love roku! if you are a cord-cutter or simply looking for a streaming device, roku is the way to go. It has everything that AppleTV has except airplay and iTunes, etc. However, there is so much content on roku, it doesn't matter. are you a fan of blind cats? there is a channel for that? are you a fan of green army men? there is a channel for that. And roku makes it pretty easy to cut thru all the clutter despite having so much content. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: TheAnsonia

customer_reviews.title: great little streamer
customer_reviews.text: Best streaming device imho. Search all installed apps/vendors from the main page is the killer feature. Another killer feature could have been the headphones from the remote feature. Except the remote will not keep a charge more than a day. As manufactured, the remote has a short that will drain your batteries & pocketbook. But, you can use a Roku app on a smart phone, or a replacement remote for as little as $5.
customer_reviews.author: jb in sd

customer_reviews.title: This is the Way I Now Enjoy Watching Movies and Television Shows
customer_reviews.text: Never in my life have I enjoyed a device as much as I enjoy Roku. I honestly think that this lightweight, shiny little black box will eventually be in everyone's home. We have three Roku boxes in our home and we've made converts of several of our friends. It's the way we now watch movies and television shows. Why not buy a Roku for your own home and see for yourself what the excitement and commotion is about. You'll soon be a convert when you learn that with a few clicks of a button, you too can be watching your favorite movies and television shows. Thank you, Roku!
customer_reviews.author: John Gennusa

customer_reviews.title: The Roku out performs SMART TVs
customer_reviews.text: We love the Roku - we have one on each TV. SMART TVs do not come close to the features and intuitive interface of the Roku (plus Roku software updates come automatically). The last TV I purchased, I intentionally shopped for one without the SMART TV features with the intent of adding a Roku 3. We use the Time Warner app (and our Time Warner login) to stream the Time Warner HD channels on all our TVs (we even don't need a cable connection to watch Time Warner cable, just a Roku) - even the TVs with a DVR box (when two things are recording at once, we can still watch TV via the Roku on that set).
customer_reviews.author: Mike S

customer_reviews.title: This review if being written based on my friend's experience ...
customer_reviews.text: This review if being written based on my friend's experience. I bought this Roku for her for Christmas. According to her, this has all the streaming apps she needs and more. It is small enough that she can actually bring it to another friend's house if they just want to have a movie night (as long as the other person has an HDMI lol). She said the remote mostly works, very few times it wouldn't but according to her it might be because there are some stuff blocking the roku as she just points from a different direction and it works. Overall she said she likes this and prefers it over apple.
customer_reviews.author: JunAKAJeff

customer_reviews.title: They have all worked well and were easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: This is our 4th Roku product. They have all worked well and were easy to set up. I don't much like having separate buttons to pause, start and wipe out what you've been watching; older remotes seemed more intuitive/easier. Absolutely hate Netflix's & Amazon's new interfaces with this Roku, makes it almost impossible to watch credits Launching you willy-nilly into next programs, instead of letting you read credits is awful. Buttons to skip directly to Netflix and Amazon are great, however. Good Roku but Netflix should have had more focus groups. Their interface is particularly bad this time around.
customer_reviews.author: Songsmith

customer_reviews.title: to the point it is annoying, as to not "confuse" anyone
customer_reviews.text: Bought a couple Rokus for Plex endpoints. Works okay most of the time, but now that Amazon Fire TV has HBOGO access I will probably switch to those as I upgrade instead of sticking with Rokus. Pros Menu is smooth and fast, especially with the WIFI remote. Updates occur regularly to add features / fix issues. Cons Games are lacking/ non existent Roku over simplifies everything, to the point it is annoying, as to not "confuse" anyone. UI has ads that cannot be removed. Plex App is ugly so you have to use Rarflix, which is better but still not that great.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great value for streaming video
customer_reviews.text: While they're far from perfect, my family has settled on Roku devices for streaming TV for years. The Roku 3 is a good option, and the headphone jack on the remote is great for late night movies. The interface could be faster, and sometimes it puts ads on the screen that I'd rather not see, but that's sort of the nature of things now, huh? Generally speaking this is a great option both from a value and functionality standpoint.
customer_reviews.author: zemmiphobe

customer_reviews.title: Movies Galore
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love the Roku. I cannot compare it to Apple or MS as I have not tried these, but there is no comparison to my Samsung Blue Ray player. Besides the obvious, significant increase in available channels, it is 80% faster and much easier to navigate. Installing was relatively easy. I had to input passwords for paid channels such as Net Flix and Hulu otherwise pretty easy. I seem to have less buffering during movie streaming but this probably will vary depending on one’s internet speed. I do wish You Tube was available but I can live without it. I highly recommend Roku and I’m very glad I got it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Change to Google DNS to get Netflix working on Roku 3
customer_reviews.text: Love the Rokus and thought the Roku 3 would be a great upgrade with all the channels it supports. Out of the box, I COULD NOT CONFIGURE NETFLIX. Everything else worked -- Amazon Prime, Pandora, Vudu, even YouTube -- but could not even connect to the Netflix channel to activate the device or login to Netflix account. Wasted a ton of time on Roku support, and finally found a website suggesting switching my wireless router's DNS to the two Google domain name servers: 8.8.8.8 and 8.8.4.4 I reconfigured my Netgear router to those DNS settings and Netflix worked! I strongly recommend this relatively simple and quick solution to anyone struggling to get their Netflix working with Roku's operating system 5.6.60.
customer_reviews.author: Mike in Arizona

customer_reviews.title: Well done Roku
customer_reviews.text: Wow, what an easy installation, HDMI, Ethernet, and power. I turned on the TV, changed the input, and the splash page for Roku was already on the screen. Course you have go through a dozen set up menus, but, in no time we're watching a movie. Only down side, occasionally the stream freezes and you get the dial spinning around. The Roku indicates the network is working and that it couldn't access any of the Netflix servers. Doubtful about that. The little booklet that Roku provided didn't address freezing up, but, looking at a support page online it says it could be several different problems, including overheating. Otherwise we're happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: The Olson Family

customer_reviews.title: Perfect set-top box
customer_reviews.text: I get most of my TV entertainment through Amazon Prime and Hulu. I used to access Hulu through the apps on my Blue-Ray player and was disappointed. My Blue-Ray player was designed to play disks; the apps were included as a "free gift with purchase." This device is designed for the streaming services. It sets up in seconds and includes a radio-based remote, which allows you to control your device without pointing it -- a great advantage when you may not be sitting in a direct line of sight with the device, or when you want to hide the device behind the television. I also recommend that you purchase a microSD card. It will improve your viewing experience.
customer_reviews.author: Ilya

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Performance - Annoyingly Complex Menus
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how high the resolution is on this thing. I can see the pores in people's faces when I watch a movie. I kid you not. We have a very fast network connection, which helps to make the performance incredible. The only downside it how Roku has increased the complexity of the menus. It really bothers me. The older versions were much more simple. Just before a movie, or TV show finishes, it drops down to a small screen in the upper left and shows you other things on the rest of the screen. You have to select it, again, to view the last 30 seconds of the program. Very annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Beta

customer_reviews.title: Not a Happy Camper!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Roku 3 Streaming Media Player less than a year ago. I have had trouble with it for a long time, thinking it was a wifi problem. However, my Roku 2 player that I purchased several months BEFORE the Roku 3 has never caused me problems. I am able to get into the Roku 3 screen to see the apps available, but when I click on an app, only the title screen appears, and I cannot get further in to see the videos available. Needless to say, I am very very unhappy with the Roku 3..
customer_reviews.author: MAC

customer_reviews.title: Perfect streaming media device
customer_reviews.text: The version 3 fixed all the problems that I had with earlier models (occasional crash, bad connectivity, sluggish menu movement.) This is the best streaming media device on the market right now by far and this is absolutely the best way possible to stick it to the cable companies that have been run so poorly for decades. To me the Roku is also sort of the equivalent of Android to Apple. Its completely open and you can install whatever apps you want including homebrew apps. Everything is totally customizable unlike the very disappointing Amazon Fire TV. With amazon prime, netflix, and Vudu I do not miss cutting cable at all.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Poole

product_meta.title: Roku 3 Streaming Media Player (2014 model)
product_meta.description:
Style:Roku 3

ROKU 3 STREAMING PLAYER 1080P HD PLUS ENHANCED REMOTE WITH HEADPHONE JACK




Faster and more powerful than ever. Enjoy 1,800+ channels of movies, TV shows, sports, and more. Plug headphones into the motion-control remote to play games or watch late-night flicks without disturbing the household. Fully loaded with one-stop search, 1080p, dual-band wireless, Ethernet, USB, plus a free Roku app. The Roku 3—the new streaming standard.

 * 1,800+ entertainment channels. Choose from the best selection and widest variety of streaming entertainment, including movies, TV shows, music, sports, news, fitness, cooking, and more.
 * Lightning fast and powerful. Experience ultra-smooth performance with a 5x faster processor and extended-range wireless.
 * Remote with headphone jack for private listening. Use the included headphones and crank up the volume to enjoy a late-night flick without disturbing the household.
 * Motion control for games. Enjoy action-packed games with a motion-control remote. Get the fun started with Angry Birds Space, included free.
 * One-stop search.* Find your favorite movies and shows in a flash from top channels like Netflix, Hulu Plus, Amazon Instant Video, VUDU, and M-GO.
 * Free iOS and Android™ app. Transform your mobile device into a Roku remote. Browse and add new channels. Even use your phone or tablet to send your music, photos and personal videos** to your HDTV.
 * All the bells and whistles. 1080p*** HD support, Ethernet and USB ports, and a microSD slot.
 * Movies and TV shows, front and center. Instantly access the hottest blockbusters and hit TV shows, powered by M-GO, right from the home screen -- no extra account setup required.

* One-stop search is for movies and TV shows and does not work with all channels. Premium subscriptions are required but are not included with purchase. 
** Capability to share video available on iOS and select Android phones. See Roku.com for a list of devices that support this feature. 
***Availability of 1080p HD video limited by channel provider and speed of broadband connection.





GET TO THE ENTERTAINMENT YOU WANT INSTANTLY
The Roku Channel Store has the largest selection of streaming channels available anywhere – with over 1,800 channels and more coming at a furious pace. Our on-screen interface lets you fly through screens, seamlessly search top channels and launch movies faster than ever before.

 * Watch a new movie a day. Every day. For 82 years. Roku has over 200,000 movies and TV episodes at your fingertips from Netflix, Hulu Plus, Amazon Instant Video, HBO GO, M-GO, VUDU, Redbox Instant by Verizon and more
 * With 49 news and weather channels from across the US and around the world, Roku is the best choice for news and weather channels. Top news sources include MSNBC, Fox News, Huffington Post, CNBC and WSJ
 * Plus gets loads of other entertainment choices, including:  * Music from Spotify, Amazon Cloud Player, Pandora, MOG, Rdio, VEVO and TuneIn
    * Live sports packages including NBA League Pass Broadband, NHL GameCenter LIVE, MLS LIVE, UFCTV, and MLB.TV Premium
    * Family entertainment from PBS and Disney
    * Photo and video sharing via Facebook, Flickr, and Picasa
   
   

Of course, there are also tons of channels featuring international and lifestyle programming, tech news, podcasts, cartoons, and… well, you get the idea.









WATCH LATE-NIGHT FLICKS WITHOUT DISTURBING THE PEACE
When you need to keep the volume down but still get your TV fix, Roku 3 features an enhanced remote with built-in headphone jack. Just plug in the included in-ear headphones to enter your own private listening world. It's perfect for cranking up that late-night action movie without waking the spouse. Or kids. Or dog.

GAMING FUN FOR THE WHOLE FAMILY
Need a break from the movies? With motion-sensing technology, the Roku 3 enhanced remote with game-ready buttons was designed for lightning-fast maneuvers and family-friendly fun. Hit games include Angry Birds Space, Wheel of Fortune and Jeopardy. Stay tuned – we're adding more games all the time.







COMPARE ROKU MODELS
Tiny stick. Big entertainment. Works with virtually any TV. Private listening headphone jack. Fully loaded and lightning fast. TV compatibility HDTVs only Virtually any TV Virtually any TV HDTVs only 1,800+ entertainment channels Built-in wireless Roku Search across multiple top channels Plays up to 1080p HD video Control with included remote or mobile devices via the Roku app Send videos, photos and music stored locally on your smartphone to your TV via the Roku app Dual-band wireless 
Channel shortcut buttons to Netflix, Amazon Instant Video and more*** Remote with headphone jack for private listening 

Cast to TV direct from the Netflix and YouTube apps 

Motion control for games (Angry Birds Space included) 

Lightning fast with 5x faster processor Ethernet, USB & microSD slot 

* Roku 3 works with HDTVs with HDMI port. HDMI cable not included with Roku players.
** Availability of 1080p HD video limited by channel provider and speed of broadband connection.

*** All units manufactured after October 2014 include a remote control that features four quick-access buttons providing one-touch access to Netflix, Amazon Instant Video, Rdio, and Hulu.


IT'S RIDICULOUSLY EASY


From the simple remote to the intuitive interface, Roku 3 was designed to set up in a few quick-and-easy steps. All you need to get started is a high-speed Internet connection (and an HDTV, of course). The built-in wireless and guided setup mean you can be up and running in minutes. And we bet you don't even have to call your nerdy nephew for help.

INCLUDED WITH THE ROKU 3
 * Enhanced remote* with headphone jack and motion control for games
 * In-ear headphones
 * Free Angry Birds Space game
 * Two AA batteries
 * Power adapter
 * Get Started guide
 * 90-day manufacturer warranty

*All units manufactured after October 2014 include a remote control that features four quick-access buttons providing one-touch access to Netflix, Amazon Instant Video, Rdio, and Hulu.


WHAT YOU NEED
 * High-speed Internet (like DSL or cable)
 * Wireless router
 * HDMI cable (for high-definition video)
 * Internet browser (for initial setup)

In general, the faster your Internet connection, the better the video quality. For the best viewing results, we recommend a minimum of 1.5 Mbps for standard definition and 3.0 Mbps for HD content. To test your network speed, visit either one of the following (free) websites: speakeasy.net/speedtest/ or www.speedtest.net. Please note that your Internet speed may vary throughout the day.


Revel in our fastest, most powerful streaming player yet. Fully loaded, the Roku 3 packs tons of entertainment into one tiny box. Enjoy 1,800+ channels of movies, TV shows, games, music, sports, and more. Plug headphones into the remote to watch late-night flicks without disturbing the household. Or use motion-control to play games like Angry Birds Space. And with one-stop search, find that perfect movie or show in a flash. 1080p HD, dual-band wireless, Ethernet and USB ports, plus free iOS and Android Roku apps so you can enjoy even more great features. The Roku 3—the new streaming standard for your HDTV.

Roku 3 supports closed captioning on channels that support this feature, including Netflix, Amazon Instant Video, VUDU and Hulu Plus. Video output: 1080p, 720p and 480p over HDMI. A USB port enables local media playback (supported formats include: MP4 (H.264) & MKV (H.264) video / AAC & MP3 audio / JPG & PNG image). Audio output: digital over HDMI (7.1/5.1 channel surround sound pass-through and stereo). 12V -- 1A power adapter.

WANT TO LEARN MORE ABOUT STREAMING MEDIA PLAYERS?

Our Streaming Media Player storefront features educational articles, buying guides, comparison charts, and more.
feature_bullets: Faster and more powerful With up to 1080p HD video and extended-range, dual band wireless performance for increased speed

Amazing remote with headphone jack Use the included in ear headphones to crank up that late night flick while the kids (or parents) sleep All units manufactured after October 2014 include a remote control that features four quick access buttons providing one touch access to Netflix, Amazon Instant Video, Rdio, and Hulu The particular unit you receive may or may not have these new quick access buttons

One stop search Find your favorite movies and TV shows all from one place from top TV and Movie services like Netflix, Amazon Instant Video or Hulu Plus 2000+ channels and growing The best selection of streaming out there
Free iOS and Android device app Use it like a remote Browse and add new channels Even stream your music and photos from your phone or tablet to your HDTV

A Roku account is free However, payment information is required during setup to provide the convenience of making purchases from the Roku Channel Store on your TV You will only be charged if you choose to make a purchase
